hymn.title: Strong are the walls around me
hymn.category: Comfort in Trials—By Enjoyment in Suffering

creators.author: Madame Jeanne-Marie Bouvier de la Motte-Guyon

layout.singingstanza: Strong are the walls a -- round me, That hold me all the day; But they who thus have bound me, Can -- not keep God a -- way: My ve -- ry dun -- geon walls are dear, Be -- cause the God I love is here.

lyrics.stanza: Strong are the walls around me, That hold me all the day; But they who thus have bound me, Cannot keep God away: My very dungeon walls are dear, Because the God I love is here.
Thy love, O God, restores me From sighs and tears to praise; And deep my soul adores Thee, Nor thinks of time or place: I ask no more, in good or ill, But union with Thy holy will.
'Tis that which makes my treasure, 'Tis that which brings my gain; Converting woe to pleasure, And reaping joy from pain. Oh, 'tis enough, whate'er befall, To know that God is All in all.
